result.execSummary:
The defendant Cordell A Crossley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Offer placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Felicia Hall.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with Huber release privileges for work, school, medical and treatment.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, to be used at the probation agent's discretion.
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 12/16/16.  Failure to pay will result in the immediate entry of a civil judgment.

Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will allow for expungement.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with Student Intern Dan Larson under the sueprvision of attorney Robert J Hampton.  May Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
HEARD BY BRANCH 31 FOR BRANCH 4. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court VACATES Jury trial date of 7/25/2016. 

Case adjourned for sentencing. Case calendared for sentencing on 8/16/2016 at 08:30 am, Branch 31.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense advised the Court that this may resolve short of trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin with legal intern Renee Arndt.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Luis B. and Jessie G.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Cordell A Crossley in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference April 28, 2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 4.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Cordell A Crossley not in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-04-2015 at 01:30pm
